The trip back is mildly uneventful. The day moved forward as the sun
slid from its mid point position to a one significantly lower in the
skies. Occasionally in the distance a large dinosaur could be seen,
from a predator who glanced in the direction of Lord Elder and Tuscon,
but who realized quickly that this metal machine was definitely not
prey; to a sauropod, who's small head on a long neck  turned to look
at the vehicle passed by, and even the smaller variety of creatures,
from scavengers to predator, ones who typically scattered as the
vehicle that was Tuscon bounced and yet moved easily across the broken
terrain.

Up ahead the trees, which had been near constant companions during
most of their trip began to break away as they came into more open
country. Up ahead the beginnings of a mountain range could be seen.
Above them a flock of what could almost look like birds flew, although
instead of possessing feathers, they had large leathery and larger
bodies.

"We're almost back" Lord Elder said. He had been silent through most
of the trip, his face wearing a thoughtful look. "There, that mountain
over there, at the base of it."

"I'll activate the door in the shield for us." Elder said as he was
about to open a communication signal to the Ark. However Elder paused
and look around, as if looking for something. "Something's wrong here
. . . " he said as he continued to look.

Above them the prehistoric avians turned almost as one, their calls
almost defiant as they moved swiftly in the direction that Tuscon and
Elder had come from. "It's like we're being watched."

(TAG)

Preston
(Lord Elder)
